stem: What is the main purpose of this notice?

options.text: To announce a new software launch.
To inform about a scheduled maintenance.
To request feedback on IT services.
To introduce new IT staff members.

explanationJa: この通知の主な目的は、予定されているメンテナンスについて情報を提供することです。選択肢Aは新しいソフトウェアの発売についてであり、選択肢CはITサービスに関するフィードバックの要求、選択肢Dは新しいITスタッフの紹介です。これらはすべて通知の内容とは無関係です。

context.passage: Notice: To all IT department staff, due to the recent server upgrades, there will be scheduled maintenance this weekend. The maintenance will start on Saturday at 10 PM and is expected to conclude by Sunday at 4 AM. During this time, the internal network and some services may be intermittently unavailable. It is advised to save your work frequently and avoid scheduling important tasks during these hours. In case of any urgent issues, please contact the IT support team.

stem: What is the main purpose of the notice?

options.text: To announce a new software launch.
To notify staff about server maintenance.
To introduce a new IT policy.
To request feedback on IT services.

explanationJa: この通知の主要な目的は、サーバーのメンテナンスについてスタッフに知らせることです。選択肢Bが正解です。選択肢Aの新しいソフトウェアの発表や、選択肢Cの新しいITポリシーの紹介、選択肢DのITサービスに関するフィードバックの依頼とは記載されていません。

context.passage:
To: All IT Department Staff
Subject: Scheduled Maintenance Notification

Dear Team,

This is to inform you that there will be a scheduled maintenance for our internal server infrastructure on Sunday, November 8th, from 12:00 AM to 6:00 AM. This maintenance is crucial to ensure the reliability and security of our network systems.

During this time, access to the corporate intranet, email services, and file storage will be temporarily unavailable. We advise all staff to save their work and log off the system by the end of the day on Saturday, November 7th.

Should you have any urgent issues or require assistance during the maintenance window, please contact the IT support hotline at (555) 123-4567.

Thank you for your cooperation and understanding.

Best regards,

Jamie Lin
IT Operations Manager

stem: What is the main purpose of the notice?

options.text: To announce a change in office hours.
To inform about upcoming system maintenance.
To request feedback on network performance.
To introduce a new IT staff member.

explanationJa: この通知の主な目的は、11月5日に予定されているシステムメンテナンスについて知らせることです。選択肢Aはオフィスの営業時間の変更について述べていますが、本文にはそのような情報はありません。選択肢Cのネットワークパフォーマンスに関するフィードバックの要請も本文にはありません。選択肢Dは新しいITスタッフの紹介についてですが、そのような情報も本文には含まれていません。従って、正解はBです。

context.passage:
To: All IT Department Staff
Subject: Scheduled System Maintenance on November 5th

Dear Team,

This is to inform you that we will be conducting a scheduled system maintenance on Sunday, November 5th, from 1:00 AM to 5:00 AM. During this period, all network services will be unavailable, including email, internal databases, and internet access. This maintenance is crucial to improve our network security and performance.

Please ensure that you save all your work and log off your computers before leaving the office on Friday, November 3rd. If you have any questions or require assistance, please contact the IT Help Desk at extension 1234.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,

Michael Tran
IT Department Manager

stem: What is the deadline for submitting budget reports?
explanationJa: この質問は、予算報告書の提出期限についてです。文中で「各部門は11月20日までに予算報告書を完成させる必要がある」と述べられているため、正解はBの11月20日です。Aの11月15日は未処理の請求書の期限であり、CとDは文中に記されていない日付です。

context.passage:
To: All Employees
Subject: Financial Year-End Procedures

As we approach the end of the fiscal year, we would like to remind all departments to finalize their budget reports by November 20. This is crucial for the accurate preparation of our annual financial statements. Each department manager should ensure that all expenditures are properly documented and submitted to the finance team. Additionally, any outstanding invoices must be cleared by November 15. Our finance team will be available to assist with any queries you may have during this period.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,

John Smith
Chief Financial Officer

stem: According to the notice, what must employees include with their reimbursement requests?

options.text: A detailed explanation of the expense
The contact information of the vendor
A copy of their monthly budget

explanationJa: この通知によると、従業員は払い戻しの申請にすべての関連する領収書と書類を添付する必要があります。選択肢Aの「費用の詳細な説明」や選択肢Bの「ベンダーの連絡先情報」、選択肢Dの「毎月の予算のコピー」は文中に記載されていません。したがって、正解はCです。

context.text:
To: All Employees
Subject: Updated Policy on Reimbursement Requests

Dear Team,

Starting from next month, we will implement a new policy regarding reimbursement requests. All employees are required to submit their requests within 30 days of the expense being incurred. This change is intended to streamline our financial processes and ensure timely processing of reimbursements. 

Additionally, please be reminded to attach all relevant receipts and documentation to your submissions. Failure to include these documents may result in delays or denial of your request. 

For further details, please refer to the updated policy document available on the company intranet.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Finance Department

stem: The finance department will conduct a comprehensive review of the budget allocations to ensure that all departments are _______ with the company's financial policies.
explanationJa: 正解は A の ‘compliant’ です。この文では、

stem: All IT department employees are required to update their passwords every three months to ensure that company data remains _____.
explanationJa: 正解はAの『secure』です。この文では『remains』の後に形容詞が必要で、「安全な状態である」ことを表現しています。Bの『securely』は副詞なので不適切です。Cの『security』は名詞なので文法的に合いません。Dの『securing』は動詞のing形で適切ではありません。

stem: The IT support team will respond to all technical inquiries ______ 24 hours of receiving them.
explanationJa: 正解はBの 'within' です。'within 24 hours' は「24時間以内に」という意味で、IT分野でよく使われる表現です。Aの 'during' は「〜の間に」という意味で時間の幅を示しますが、期限内を表すには不適切です。Cの 'among' は「〜の中で（3つ以上の物や人）」の意味で、この文脈には合いません。Dの 'beneath' は「〜の下に」で場所を表すため、意味が合いません。

stem: The marketing department will launch a new social media campaign next week, so all team members are expected to ______ in the planning meeting.
explanationJa: 正解はAの“participate”です。主語は“all team members”で複数形なので、動詞の原形が必要です。Bの“participates”は三人称単数現在形で合いません。Cの“participating”は進行形または分詞となり、文法上不適切です。Dの“participated”は過去形で、時制が一致しません。

stem: What is one advantage of registering for the event in advance?

options.text: Participants receive special discounts on marketing technology.
Attendees are guaranteed a lower ticket price.
Guests can access free parking near the venue.
Keynote speakers will offer private consultations.

explanationJa: 正解はBです。本文には、事前購入の場合は35ドル、当日購入の場合は45ドルと記載されているため、事前登録の利点はチケット価格が安くなることです。Aの「特別割引」やDの「個別相談」については本文に記載がなく、Cの「無料駐車場」はすべての参加者が利用できると明記されています。したがって、Bが最も適切な選択肢です。

context.passage:
Marketing Professionals Networking Event

The City Business Center is excited to host its annual Marketing Professionals Networking Event on September 14 from 5:00 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. at the Oakwood Conference Hall. This event brings together over 200 marketing experts, consultants, and business leaders for an evening of industry presentations, panel discussions, and professional networking opportunities.

Highlights include keynote speeches by renowned marketing strategists, interactive workshops on digital campaign management, and a showcase of the latest marketing technologies. Light refreshments will be provided throughout the event. 

Tickets can be purchased in advance for $35 via our website or at the door for $45 (subject to availability). Early registration is strongly recommended, as space is limited. For more information, contact events@citybusinesscenter.org.

Note: Complimentary parking is available in the East Lot for all event participants.

stem: Select the best answer

options.text: Thank you for your attention to this announcement.
We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
Your feedback on the last workshop was greatly appreciated.
Please submit your monthly reports by the end of the week.

explanationJa: Aは、案内文の締めくくりとして自然であり、イベント告知の最後によく使われる表現です。他の選択肢は文脈に合いません。Bは謝罪を表しており、イベントのお知らせには不要です。Cは前回のワークショップへのフィードバックに言及していますが、今回のイベント案内には直接関係がありません。Dは月次レポートの提出依頼であり、イベントの案内には無関係です。

context.text:
To: All Marketing Team Members
Subject: Annual Marketing Innovation Workshop

We are excited to announce the Annual Marketing Innovation Workshop, which will take place on September 15th in the Oak Conference Room. The workshop will feature guest speakers from top advertising firms and interactive sessions designed to enhance our creative strategies. Please remember to register by September 5th to secure your spot. Light refreshments will be provided during the breaks, and all participants are encouraged to bring their business cards for networking opportunities. If you have any questions regarding the event, please contact the organizing committee at marketing-events@company.com. We look forward to your active participation and to making this event a great success. 【_____】

stem: What is the main purpose of the notice?

options.text: To announce the implementation of a new software update
To inform staff about a new employee joining the department
To provide training details for the IT department
To request feedback on system performance

explanationJa: この通知の主な目的は、新しいソフトウェア更新の実施を発表することです。選択肢Aが正解です。選択肢Bは新しい従業員についてであり、選択肢Cはトレーニングの詳細を提供すること、選択肢Dはシステム性能についてのフィードバックを求めることに関するもので、いずれも本文の内容には該当しません。

context.passage:
Notice: 

To all IT department staff,

Please be informed that starting next Monday, November 7th, the company will be implementing a new software update across all our systems. This update is crucial to enhance security protocols and improve system performance. Affected systems will be offline from 10:00 PM to 2:00 AM each night during the update period. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your cooperation.

For any questions or concerns, please contact the IT helpdesk at extension 234.

Thank you for your attention.

Best regards,
IT Management

stem: When is the IT department staff meeting scheduled?
explanationJa: 正しい答えは B です。文章に「次回のスタッフ会議は11月15日に予定されています」と明確に書かれています。他の選択肢 A、C、D は誤りで、文章に記載されていない日付です。

context.passage:
IT Department Staff Meeting Schedule:

To all IT department members,

Please be informed of the upcoming staff meeting scheduled as follows:

Date: November 15, 2025
Time: 10:00 AM - 11:30 AM
Location: Conference Room B

Agenda:
1. Review of current projects
2. Upcoming software updates
3. Q&A session

All team members are expected to attend. Please prepare any questions or concerns you may have about ongoing projects. Your input is valuable to us.

Best regards,

James Ortega
IT Department Manager

stem: What is the main purpose of the notice?

options.text: To inform employees about a change in security policy.
To announce a mandatory IT security training session.
To provide an update on company ID policy.
To notify employees about a new IT support contact.

explanationJa: このお知らせの主な目的は、従業員にITセキュリティトレーニングセッションについて知らせることです。本文では、11月15日に年次セキュリティトレーニングが開催されると明記されています。選択肢Aはセキュリティポリシーの変更についてですが、そのような情報はありません。選択肢CとDも本文には触れられていない情報に基づいています。

context.passage:
Notice: 
To all employees,

We are pleased to announce that the annual IT security training session will be held on November 15th at 10:00 AM in the main conference room. This training is mandatory for all staff members to ensure that everyone is up to date with the latest security protocols. Please make sure to bring your company ID and a laptop for the hands-on session. Refreshments will be provided. For any questions, contact the IT department at it_support@company.com.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,

The IT Department

stem: What is the main purpose of the notice?

options.text: To announce a new hiring in the IT department
To inform staff about a scheduled system upgrade
To request feedback on the recent changes in the system
To invite staff to a team-building event

explanationJa: この通知の主な目的は、11月15日に予定されているシステムアップグレードについてスタッフに通知することです。選択肢Bが正解です。選択肢Aは新規採用について言及していませんし、選択肢Cは変更に関するフィードバックを求めているわけではありません。選択肢Dはチームビルディングイベントへの招待についても言及していません。

context.passage:
Notice: 

To all IT Department Staff,

We are excited to announce that the system upgrade scheduled for November 15th will introduce several new features aimed at improving our workflow efficiency. The upgrade will begin at 8:00 PM and is expected to last approximately four hours. During this time, access to the network will be unavailable. Please ensure all work is saved and systems are shut down prior to the start of the upgrade. 

Additionally, a training session on the new features will be held on November 16th at 10:00 AM in the main conference room. Attendance is mandatory for all staff members. Please direct any questions or concerns to the IT support team.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,

The IT Management Team

stem: Which of the following is mentioned in the passage?

options.text: Plans to introduce a new outreach program.

explanationJa: 本文は新たな取り組みの導入を述べており、値引きや製品回収、修理手順は含まれていません。

context.passage:
The community center has announced an employee wellness initiative to improve public awareness. The marketing team has announced an employee wellness initiative to support local businesses. The city council will introduce an employee wellness initiative to foster collaboration across departments. The community center is planning an employee wellness initiative to help first-time participants. A travel agency is planning a series of workshops to support local businesses.

A travel agency decided to launch an annual charity event to support local businesses. Our company will introduce an annual charity event to share practical skills. The city council has announced a weekend festival to share practical skills. The city council started coordinating an annual charity event to foster collaboration across departments. Our company will expand an employee wellness initiative to support local businesses.

Our company has announced a pilot project to gather feedback from residents. The city council is preparing a new outreach program to gather feedback from residents. The city council is preparing an annual charity event to foster collaboration across departments. A local nonprofit is preparing a pilot project to share practical skills.

stem: The report, ______ was finalized yesterday, will be shared with all staff.
explanationJa: 非制限用法（カンマあり）では which を用いる。that は不可。

stem: This model is ______ than the previous version, making it ideal for travel.
explanationJa: 比較級 than に合わせて lighter を選びます。

stem: In order to enhance student engagement, the university has decided to ______ new interactive learning tools in its curriculum this semester.
explanationJa: 正解はAのintegrateです。「統合する、取り入れる」という意味で、文脈上「新しいインタラクティブな学習ツールをカリキュラムに取り入れる」が適切です。Bのsegregateは「分離する」で逆の意味です。Cのmitigateは「緩和する」で文脈に合いません。Dのimplicateは「巻き込む、含意する」で意味が異なります。

stem: Select the best answer
explanationJa: 正解はBの「Since」です。この文では、新しいシステムの導入が顧客満足度向上の一環であることを示しています。「Since」を用いることで、「私たちが顧客満足度の向上に焦点を合わせ続けているので、新しいシステムに関するあなたのフィードバックが貴重です」という因果関係を示しています。他の選択肢は文脈に合いません。「Although」は逆接の文脈で使われ、「Therefore」は結果を示す際に使われ、「However」は対比を示す際に使われますが、いずれもこの文脈にはそぐわないです。

context.text:
Subject: Customer Support Team Update

Dear Team,

I am pleased to announce that starting next month, our customer support team will implement a new ticketing system designed to enhance efficiency and improve response times. This system will allow us to better track customer inquiries and provide timely solutions. To ensure a smooth transition, training sessions will be held over the next two weeks. Please make sure to attend one of the sessions as scheduled.

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to me directly. Your cooperation and dedication are greatly appreciated as we strive to provide top-notch service to our clients.

Best regards,

Alice Johnson
Customer Support Manager

【_____】 we continue to focus on enhancing customer satisfaction, your feedback on the new system will be invaluable.

stem: What is the purpose of this notice?

options.text: To announce a change in the network maintenance schedule.
To inform staff of a new software update.
To request feedback on IT services.
To introduce a new IT policy.

explanationJa: この通知の目的は、ネットワーク保守のスケジュール変更を知らせることです。選択肢Aが正解です。選択肢Bの「新しいソフトウェアの更新について」は本文で言及されておらず、選択肢Cの「ITサービスに関するフィードバックの依頼」や選択肢Dの「新しいITポリシーの紹介」も本文に含まれていません。

context.passage:
Notice: 

To all IT department staff, 

Please be informed that the network maintenance scheduled for next week has been postponed. The new maintenance window will be from 10:00 PM on Saturday, November 10, to 6:00 AM on Sunday, November 11. Please ensure that all critical data is backed up before the maintenance begins. During this period, network services will not be available. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding and cooperation. 

If you have any questions, please contact the IT support desk at extension 1234. 

Thank you, 

IT Department Management

stem: When will the mandatory safety training session take place?
explanationJa: この問題では、必須の安全トレーニングセッションの日付を尋ねています。正解はAの「11月15日」で、文中に明確に記載されています。他の選択肢は、トレーニングセッションの日付としては不正確であり、文中にも触れられていません。よって、Aが正しい答えです。

context.passage:
Attention all employees: 

As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and productive work environment, we will be conducting a mandatory safety training session on November 15th, 2025. All staff members are required to attend this session, which will begin at 10:00 AM in the main conference room. Please ensure you arrive on time, as the session will cover essential safety protocols and emergency procedures. Failure to attend may result in disciplinary action. If you have any questions regarding the training, please contact the HR department. Thank you for your cooperation.

stem: What is the main purpose of the notice?

options.text: To inform employees about a new password policy.
To remind employees of the holiday schedule.
To provide updates on software installations.

explanationJa: この通知の主な目的は、新しいパスワードポリシーについて従業員に通知することです。選択肢Aは、通知の内容を正確に反映しています。選択肢Bは、会議についての情報ではなく、選択肢Cは休日のスケジュールに関する内容であり、選択肢Dはソフトウェアのインストールに関する更新について言及しています。

context.passage:
Attention all employees,

In order to enhance our cybersecurity measures, we will be implementing a new password policy effective from November 15, 2025. All employees are required to update their passwords to meet the following criteria: at least 12 characters long, including uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters. Failure to comply with this policy may result in restricted access to company systems.

For assistance in creating a strong password or if you have any questions regarding this new policy, please contact the IT department at it-support@company.com.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,

The IT Security Team

stem: What is the main purpose of the passage?

options.text: To provide technical instructions for repairs.
To issue a safety recall notice.
To announce or describe an upcoming initiative.

explanationJa: 段落全体が『新たな取り組みや計画の告知・説明』に一貫して言及しています。
